trans-unit.source: Represents a security token that is based upon an X.509 certificate and that the certificate is mapped to a Windows domain user or local computer user account.

Typically, application developers do not need to use the X509WindowsSecurityToken class, unless a Web service must gain access to details about a X.509 certificate referenced in an incoming SOAP message or the domain or computer account that the certificate is mapped to.
To get the details of the X.509 certificate, access the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate%2A> property.
To get the user identity, see the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509WindowsSecurityToken.WindowsIdentity%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509WindowsSecurityToken"></xref> class using the specified X.509 certificate and Windows domain or computer account.

This constructor creates a unique identifier for the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509WindowsSecurityToken> security token and assigns that value to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Id%2A> property.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> that contains the X.509 certificate.
A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> that represents the identity of a Windows domain or computer account.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509WindowsSecurityToken"></xref> class using the specified X.509 certificate, Windows domain or computer account, and unique identifier.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> that contains the X.509 certificate.
A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> that represents the identity of a Windows domain or computer account.
A unique identifier of the security token.
Creates a new instance of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509WindowsSecurityToken"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> that contains the X.509 certificate.
Represents the identity of a Windows domain or computer account.
The authentication type for the token.
A unique identifier for the security token.
Gets the authentication type for the token.
Returns <xref:System.String>.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509WindowsSecurityToken"></xref>.
Call the Dispose method when you are finished using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509WindowsSecurityToken>.
The Dispose method leaves the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509WindowsSecurityToken> in an unusable state.

After calling the Dispose method, you must release all references to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509WindowsSecurityToken> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509WindowsSecurityToken> was occupying.
> [!NOTE] > Always call the Dispose method before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509WindowsSecurityToken>.
Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509WindowsSecurityToken> object's `Finalize` method.
Gets the identity of a Windows domain or computer account.
A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> that represents the identity of a Windows domain or computer account.
